wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.core.operation

Interface ImageDomainProjection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImageDomainProjectionGeneric

    public interface ImageDomainProjection
    Author:
    remy Implements the Projection of the voxels of an image onto a coordinate plane (projection perpendicular to one of the axis), and computes voxels according to two policies:
    • Tomography, in which an average of the values of all the voxels projected on a given pixel is used;
    • Volume Rendering, in which the maximum of the values of all the voxels projected on a given pixel is used;

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ImageCore projectionTomography(CoordinateAxis axis, boolean maximizeContrast)
      Creates a 2D image with each pixel color equal to the average of gray level along a line parallel to a coordinate axis which projects onto that pixel.
      ImageCore projectionVolumeRendering(CoordinateAxis axis, boolean maximizeContrast)
      Creates a 2D image with each pixel color equal to the maximum of all gray levels along a line parallel to a coordinate axis which projects onto that pixel.

    • Method Detail

      • projectionTomography

        ImageCore projectionTomography(CoordinateAxis axis,
                               boolean maximizeContrast)
        Creates a 2D image with each pixel color equal to the average of gray level along a line parallel to a coordinate axis which projects onto that pixel.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis along which to project
        maximizeContrast - If true, the gray scales in the output image should be scaled so as to maximize contrast among possible colors. A Blurring filter is also applied before scaling.
        Returns:
        The 2D image with pixel's gray levels averaging the image along one direction.

      • projectionVolumeRendering

        ImageCore projectionVolumeRendering(CoordinateAxis axis,
                                    boolean maximizeContrast)
        Creates a 2D image with each pixel color equal to the maximum of all gray levels along a line parallel to a coordinate axis which projects onto that pixel.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis along which to project
        maximizeContrast - If true, the gray scales in the output image should be scaled so as to maximize contrast among possible colors. A Blurring filter is also applied before scaling.
        Returns:
        The 2D image with pixel's gray levels averaging the image along one direction.
